intro: Kosteletzkya virginica var. typica, commonly known as the sea oxeye, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has hairy, branching stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically arranged in clusters and are adapted to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is well-suited to saline and sandy soils, making it a common sight in coastal dunes and marshes.
